intro: Senecio platylepis, commonly known as the broad-leaved senecio, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its leaves are broad and fleshy, adapted to conserve water, while its yellow flowers bloom in clusters. Senecio platylepis is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and resilience in dry conditions.
